column4: ok ok ok ok _ I found the solution to connecting to vista with rdp
the version of rdesktop in ubuntu is too old
you need version 1.5 of rdesktop
soooooooooooo....
does any one know where i can find it for ubntu
rdesktop-1.5 for ubuntu
debian has it
but you can not install it in ubuntu
and so does Ubuntu
sudo apt-get install rdesktop
do you have the extra resporities enabled?
yes i do...
ah, I see - rdesktop is oly 1.4 in Ubuntu
a backport?
could try converting an RPM to deb with Alien
good idea.... But why are updates packages usually not built for existing versions of ubuntu? Upgrading an entire os distro for the sake of a few apps is nonsense...
latest and greatest doesn't always mean most stable. It means they'd have to test it all again
also, with a 6 month release cycle, the latest will be in there in 6 months. So unless a program has a release cycle of 1 week, it will amost always be the latest
you can still, install most applications.

you can install thousands of programs that _will_ work, and by safe to use. With windows you take a gamble as to wheter this random .exe file you found on the interwebs will be the last time you'll see your Windows desktop or not
you can eaisly install it though, get the .rpm file and convert it with alien
I know..  I will... mandriva has provided the rpm...
